item.title: Description
item.description: By knowledge in this context, we mean reproduction knowledge; this can be divided into factual knowledge on the one hand and summarizing (or understanding) on the other [@van1999zicht]. With factual knowledge, the question is whether the student has remembered the knowledge. An example of factual knowledge is being able to name the characteristics of a mammal. Summarizing is about whether the student has understood the subject matter. This could include, for example, explaining the operation of a combustion engine in your own words.

item.title: Tips
item.description: Emphasize the student’s ethical responsibility not to cheat. Ensure good communication with the students. Be transparent about the online assessment process, so that students know what to expect. Let them know for example which personal details will be needed and what they will be used for, and what they need to have with them (e.g. a student card, telephone or camera). If online proctoring will be used, be clear about what the students can expect and what the rules are.
